official-title.#text:
To allow the importation, distribution, and sale of investigational drugs and devices intended for 
use by terminally ill patients who execute an informed consent document.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Drugs and devices for use by terminally ill patients
Drugs and devices for use by terminally ill patients

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 351 of the Public Health Service Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not implement or enforce any provision
			 of law preventing or restricting, the importation, distribution, or sale
			 of an investigational drug or device intended for use by a terminally ill
			 patient in accordance with subsection (b).

text.#text:
In order for an investigational drug or device to be intended for use in accordance with this
			 subsection, such drug or device must be intended for use by a patient who
			 has—
been diagnosed with a terminal illness by a licensed physician;

been informed by a licensed physician that no drug or device that is lawfully marketed in the
			 United States is likely to cure the illness; and
executed a written informed consent document that states—
the known and potential risks and benefits of such drug or device; and

any indications of the illness for which a drug or device is lawfully marketed, or for which
			 treatment is otherwise available, in the United States.
